macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: FTSE 100 Ends Week at Record High of 10,446
items.summary: The FTSE 100 gained 43 points to close at 10,446, while the FTSE 250 rose 0.52% to 23,427.27, marking a positive end to the week amid strong UK stock performance.

items.title: S&P 500 Ekes Out Gain but Ends Tough Week Lower; Nasdaq Extends Losses
items.summary: The S&P 500 managed a small Friday gain but closed the week down, while the Nasdaq Composite fell for a fourth straight day, capping its fifth weekly loss since 2022, now over 2% below its January record.

items.title: Gold Nears Record High Near $5,000 per Ounce After US Inflation Data
items.summary: Gold traded close to $5,000 per ounce at a near-record weekly high, with silver surging above $77 per ounce following fresh US inflation data release.

items.title: Magnificent Seven ETF Breaks Below 40-Week Average Amid Tech Weakness
items.summary: The Magnificent Seven ETF has fallen below its 40-week moving average, highlighting US market dependence on Big Tech stocks, with strategists eyeing potential support at the 200-day average.

items.title: MarketBeat Highlights Large-Cap Tech Stocks to Watch: QQQ, NVDA, TSLA
items.summary: Invesco QQQ, NVIDIA, Tesla, Apple, Micron, and Microsoft topped large-cap trading volume, with mega-cap earnings poised to influence the tech sector's direction.

items.title: Pandora Shifts to Platinum Plating Amid Precious Metals Volatility
items.summary: Jewelry maker Pandora announced transition from silver to platinum across products due to extreme volatility in silver and precious metal markets.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: LHCb Collaboration Uses AI to Study Top Quarks and Higgs Bosons
items.summary: The LHCb collaboration published two papers demonstrating the use of machine learning and deep learning to measure properties of top quarks and Higgs bosons at CERN's Large Hadron Collider. The breakthrough enables measurements previously thought impossible, including top quark charge asymmetry and enhanced Higgs decay reconstruction.

items.title: AI-Powered Gene Maps Reveal Alzheimer's Control Networks
items.summary: Researchers at UC Irvine developed SIGNET, a machine learning platform that identifies cause-and-effect relationships in genes linked to Alzheimer's disease. The study identified new biological pathways contributing to memory loss and potential treatment targets.

items.title: Sophisticated AI Bot Swarms Pose Unprecedented Threat to Democracy
items.summary: Researchers warn that coordinated swarms of AI-generated social media bots are now sophisticated enough to evade detection tools and mimic human behavior. The threat is no longer theoretical, with evidence suggesting these tactics are already being deployed online.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Playable Worlds Lays Off Staff on Stars Reach Development
items.summary: Raph Koster's Playable Worlds announced layoffs affecting its online game Stars Reach, following recent industry trends and potential funding issues from last year's Kickstarter. The studio confirms the game remains in development with ongoing playtests and no announced release date.

items.title: Ashes of Creation Shuts Down with Staff Layoffs
items.summary: Ashes of Creation has been shut down with staff layoffs, continuing a wave of cutbacks in the gaming industry amid funding challenges.

items.title: BCG Report Projects Gaming Revenue to $353 Billion by 2030
items.summary: BCG's 2026 report highlights video gaming revenue at $263 billion in 2025, forecasting growth to $353 billion by 2030 driven by cloud gaming, AI content, cross-platform play, and creator economies. It notes esports overlaps like NBA 2K League and athlete gamers such as LeBron James.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
